author: VNExplorer
title: Russia may have lost half of its MiG-31Ks but it can make more
text: Photo: The Russian army could lose half of its MiG-31Ks (wikipedia.org) As a result of the Ukrainian strike on the Savasleyka airfield, the Russian army could have lost half of its MiG-31Ks, which are capable of carrying the Kinzhal missile. But Russia is capable of replenishing the fleet of these missile carriers, according to Bohdan Dolintse, an aviation expert and head of the Institute of Management and Strategies. According to Dolintse, before the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, there was information that Russia had 12 MiG-31K aircraft in service. Earlier, the destruction of one of them was confirmed, and another was destroyed during the strike on Savasleyka. â€œSo now there are 10 of them. At least 5 more were damaged. How badly they were damaged remains a question. If they were damaged so badly that they cannot be repaired, then we can say that 50% of the media were destroyed. If they can be quickly restored, then we will only be talking about a temporary reduction in these media,â€ the expert says. At the same time, Dolintse reminds that the MiG-31K was created based on the MiG-31 version B or BS. According to him, there are still more than 100 such aircraft in the Russian army's inventory. â€œWe have to understand that even the destruction of all the MiG-31Ks available today does not mean that Russia will no longer have these aircraft. Of course, they will need some time, which may take from 6 months to a year, but they will be able to get new carriers,â€ he adds. Russia's MiG-31K threat to Ukraine The MiG-31K is a two-seat supersonic, all-weather, long-range fighter interceptor capable of carrying the Kh-47M Kinzhal hypersonic missile. This missile can reach any point on the territory of Ukraine in a matter of minutes, and can only be intercepted by Patriot and Samp-T air defense systems. Therefore, the use of these missiles by the Russians poses a serious threat to Ukrainians. Strike on Russian Savasleyka airfield Recently, it became known that the Defense Intelligence of Ukraine attacked the Russian airfield Savasleyka with drones. As a result of the attack on August 16, a MiG-31K/I aircraft, two Il-76 aircraft, and about five aircraft, probably MiG-31K/I, were destroyed.

author: Karolin Wiltgrupp
title: Vom Schimmelhaus in die Tropfstein-Casita: Danni BÃ¼chner mit den Nerven am Ende
text:
Vom Schimmelhaus in die Tropfstein-Casita: Danni BÃ¼chner mit den Nerven am Ende
Mallorca - Weil das alte Haus bereits schimmelte, war schnell klar: Die BÃ¼chners mÃ¼ssen umziehen. Im Internet findet die Familie kurzerhand ein neues, passendes Objekt. Doch beim Einzug entpuppt sich die einstige Traum-Casita als kleiner Albtraum!
Als wÃ¤ren die MissverstÃ¤ndnisse mit dem Umzugsunternehmen nicht schon stressig genug, treten bei der Ankunft am neuen Haus weitere "Baustellen" auf.
Im gesamten GebÃ¤ude lÃ¤uft nÃ¤mlich kein Wasser, die Pumpe ist defekt. Die Techniker kÃ¶nnen das Problem aber erst am nÃ¤chsten Tag beheben. "Du kannst dich ja mit Wasserflaschen duschen", empfiehlt Jada (20) ihrer Mutter Danni (47) in der zweiten Folge "Diese BÃ¼chners - Familientrubel unter Palmen".
Doch damit nicht genug. Als es drauÃŸen zu regnen beginnt, tropft es auch in Jadas neues Zimmer rein. Eine Wand ist durchlÃ¤ssig, der Boden wird nass.
Daniela BÃ¼chner zurÃ¼ck im TV: Musste RTLZWEI heftige Szenen rausschneiden?
"Kann und will nicht mehr weiterleben": Danni BÃ¼chner erinnert sich an ihren Jens (â€ 49)
Danni alarmiert ihren neuen Vermieter, ist aber schon jetzt mit den Nerven am Ende: "Ich weiÃŸ nicht, ob ich lachen oder heulen soll."
Zwar konnte die Wasserpumpe repariert werden, doch das Tropf-Problem an der Wand besteht weiter. Immerhin ist der GroÃŸteil geschafft: "Willkommen zu Hause", freut sich die Familie.
Joelina und Jada sehen sich nach heftigem Streit wieder
Nachdem der Umzug geschafft ist, geht es fÃ¼r die FÃ¼nffach-Mama und ihre ZweitÃ¤lteste zu einem Job nach Hamburg.
Doch zuvor wollen die beiden noch Joelina (26) besuchen, die vor einigen Monaten in die Hansestadt gezogen ist. WÃ¤hrend Danni ihre Tochter zwischendrin in KÃ¶ln wiedergetroffen hat, haben sich Jada und ihre groÃŸe Schwester lange nicht mehr gesehen.
Kurz vor Joelinas Auszug hatten sich die zwei Schwestern noch extrem in die Haare bekommen. Das erste Wiedersehen nach vier Monaten fÃ¤llt zunÃ¤chst etwas frostig aus. "Du umarmst mich nicht mal", echauffiert sich Jada.
Danni BÃ¼chner zieht blank! TV-Auswanderin macht sich fÃ¼r Playboy nackig
SpÃ¤ter witzeln die beiden doch wieder herum, und Joelina nimmt die 20-JÃ¤hrige in den Arm.
Die zweite Staffel von "Diese BÃ¼chners - Familientrubel unter Palmen" seht Ihr immer donnerstags, um 21.15 Uhr, bei RTLZWEI. Auf RTL+ kÃ¶nnt Ihr die neuen Folgen schon vorab streamen.
Titelfoto: Bildmontage: Picture Puzzle Medien (2)

title: Instacare Home Health Solutions Continues to Lead with Premier Companion Care in Piscataway, NJ | User | theeveningleader.com
text:

Our tailored companion care services are designed to meet the unique needs of each individual, fostering a sense of belonging and support," stated Dani Sabo, owner of Instacare Home Health Solutions.
Instacare's dedication to offering high-quality companion care in Piscataway, NJ, addresses the growing demand for reliable, empathetic home care services. The agency's comprehensive range of services, including social interaction, daily living assistance, and emotional support, underscores its mission to provide care that not only meets but surpasses the needs of its clients.
The steadfast commitment of Instacare Home Health Solutions to maintaining its status as one of the best home care agencies in Piscataway, NJ, is evident in its continued efforts to innovate and improve its services. By prioritizing the needs of its clients and employing a team of highly skilled and compassionate caregivers, Instacare ensures that the community of Piscataway, NJ, has access to exceptional care that enriches lives and fosters independence.
For more information about Instacare Home Health Solutions and their companion care in Piscataway, NJ , please visit their website at https://instacarehome.com
About Instacare Home Health Solutions:
Instacare Home Health Solutions is a leading companion care provider and comprehensive home care in Piscataway, NJ. Known for its commitment to quality, compassion, and excellence, Instacare has established itself as one of Piscataway, NJ's best home care agencies. With a focus on personalized care plans and the well-being of its clients, Instacare Home Health Solutions continues to impact the community it serves significantly.

title: Maduro ordena una â€œacciÃ³n defensivaâ€ en respuesta a la llegada de un buque de guerra britÃ¡nico a Guyana
text:
REPERCUSIONES
Maduro ordena una â€œacciÃ³n defensivaâ€ en respuesta a la llegada de un buque de guerra britÃ¡nico a Guyana
El anuncio lo hizo frente a la cÃºpula militar, durante una reuniÃ³n que fue transmitida en la radio y televisiÃ³n, en la que se comunicÃ³ con un grupo de efectivos castrenses que concretaron â€œla primera faseâ€ de esta operaciÃ³n, lo que consistiÃ³ en un despliegue sobre tierra y aguas del estado Sucre (noreste).
El presidente venezolano NicolÃ¡s Maduro ordenÃ³ este jueves una acciÃ³n defensiva en el ocÃ©ano AtlÃ¡ntico en respuesta a la llegada de un buque de guerra britÃ¡nico a las costas de Guyana, lo que ha disparado nuevamente la tensiÃ³n entre los paÃ­ses sudamericanos que mantienen una disputa territorial.
"He ordenado la activaciÃ³n de una acciÃ³n conjunta de toda la Fuerza Armada Nacional Bolivariana (FANB) sobre el Caribe oriental de Venezuela, sobre la fachada atlÃ¡ntica, una acciÃ³n conjunta de carÃ¡cter defensivo como respuesta a la provocaciÃ³n y a la amenaza del Reino Unido contra la paz y la soberanÃ­a de nuestro paÃ­sâ€.
El anuncio lo hizo frente a la cÃºpula militar, durante una reuniÃ³n que fue transmitida en la radio y televisiÃ³n, en la que se comunicÃ³ con un grupo de efectivos castrenses que concretaron â€œla primera faseâ€ de esta operaciÃ³n, lo que consistiÃ³ en un despliegue sobre tierra y aguas del estado Sucre (noreste).
Maduro no dio detalles sobre el alcance y duraciÃ³n de esta operaciÃ³n pero insistiÃ³ en que la llegada del HMS Trent britÃ¡nico es una â€œamenaza inaceptableâ€ que es una â€œrupturaâ€ de los acuerdos que suscribiÃ³ con su par guyanÃ©s, Irfaan Ali, el pasado 14 de diciembre, cuando se comprometieron a no amenazarse mutuamente y evitar incidentes relacionadas con la disputa.
â€œVenezuela no se puede quedar de brazos cruzados frente a una amenaza, estamos respondiendo en la medida proporcionalâ€, asegurÃ³, tras reiterar que apuesta por la diplomacia y la paz, y criticÃ³ que Guyana haya desoÃ­do los pedidos de Venezuela de no aceptar la llegada del barco britÃ¡nico a sus costas.

author: Fox Sports
title: Donnarumma estarÃ¡ INACTIVO por brutal patada de Singo, quien se disculpa: â€˜Evidentemente no fue intencionalâ€™
text:
Gianluigi Donnarumma sufriÃ³ una cortada en el rostro durante la victoria de PSG sobre Monaco a domicilio en partido de Ligue 1 y el conjunto parisino ya compartiÃ³ reporte mÃ©dico de su portero.
AdemÃ¡s, Wilfried Singo, que terminÃ³ lesionando al italiano, ofreciÃ³ disculpas vÃ­a redes sociales y asegurÃ³ que â€˜obviamenteâ€™ no fue intencional, ante insultos racistas en su contra.
TE PUEDE INTERESAR: AS MÃ³naco denuncia insultos racistas contra el jugador que le abriÃ³ la cara a Gianluigi Donnarumma

Durante el partido entre Monaco y PSG de la Ligue 1, Wilfried Singo terminÃ³ con los tachones de su zapato en el rostro de Gianluigi Donnarumma. Evidentemente tuvo que salir de cambio y requiriÃ³ de varios puntos, pero ahora se confirmÃ³ que estarÃ¡ fuera de actividad por un tiempo.

Donnarumma estarÃ¡ inactivo por entrada de Singo
Aunque Gianluigi Donnarumma estÃ¡ estable luego de la llamativa cortada en la mejilla, se confirmÃ³ que estarÃ¡ fuera de actividad â€˜unos dÃ­asâ€™, confirmÃ³ el PSG.
â€œVÃ­ctima de un traumatismo facial con mÃºltiples heridas, Gianluigi Donnarumma regresarÃ¡ esta tarde a ParÃ­s con el equipo. MaÃ±ana se someterÃ¡ a exÃ¡menes mÃ©dicos y deberÃ¡ permanecer inactivo durante varios dÃ­asâ€, confirmÃ³ el Paris Saint-Germain vÃ­a redes sociales.
AdemÃ¡s, el portero compartiÃ³ una fotografÃ­a en casa con su perro en la que se aprecia la brutal cortada tapada por una gaza mÃ©dica.
Tutto bene ðŸ½

Wilfried Singo pidiÃ³ perdÃ³n a Gianluigi Donnarumma
â€œMe gustarÃ­a pedir disculpas a Gianluigi Donnarumma. Evidentemente mi gesto no fue voluntario, pero luego pude ver que tenÃ­a una herida importante en la cara. Te deseo una buena recuperaciÃ³nâ€.
AsÃ­ fue como Wilfried Singo ofreciÃ³ disculpas a Gianluigi Donnarumma vÃ­a redes sociales luego de la desafortunada jugada que le provocÃ³ una sensible y aparatosa lesiÃ³n en el rostro al portero italiano del PSG durante el triunfo sobre Monaco en Ligue 1.

author: EFE
title: JUICIO META | Comienza el juicio contra Zuckerberg por el uso de datos de millones de usuarios de Facebook
text:
El juicio contra el director ejecutivo de Meta, Mark Zuckerberg , y otros altos cargos de la compaÃ±Ã­a por el uso y la explotaciÃ³n indebida de datos de millones de usuarios de Facebook para la consultora polÃ­tica Cambridge Analytica comenzÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles en Delaware (Estados Unidos) con las declaraciones de los primeros testigos . El primer dÃ­a del proceso judicial contÃ³ con los testigos Neil Richards , un experto en privacidad llamado a comparecer por los demandantes, y Jeffrey Zients , que formÃ³ parte de la junta directiva de Facebook de 2018 a 2020 y que posteriormente fue jefe de gabinete de la Casa Blanca bajo la presidencia del demÃ³crata Joe Biden , segÃºn informan medios estadounidenses.
El caso contra Zuckerberg comenzÃ³ en 2018 cuando se desvelÃ³ que la empresa britÃ¡nica Cambridge Analytica utilizÃ³ una aplicaciÃ³n para recopilar millones de datos de internautas de Facebook sin su consentimiento y con fines polÃ­ticos , y se sirviÃ³ de ellos para elaborar perfiles psicolÃ³gicos de votantes que supuestamente vendieron a la campaÃ±a del ahora presidente de EE.UU., Donald Trump , durante las elecciones de 2016, que tambiÃ©n ganÃ³.
Este escÃ¡ndalo puso a Meta en el foco de atenciÃ³n de los reguladores en todo el mundo, y la ComisiÃ³n Federal del Comercio de EE.UU. (FTC, en inglÃ©s) anunciÃ³ una sanciÃ³n a Facebook de 5.000 millones de dÃ³lares por infringir un acuerdo de 2012 con esta entidad que requerÃ­a proteger los datos personales de los usuarios.
Posteriormente, accionistas de Meta Platforms, empresa matriz de Facebook, Instagram y WhatsApp, demandaron al director ejecutivo de Meta, Mark Zuckerberg, asÃ­ como a altos cargos de la empresa.
En su litigio, los demandantes piden que tanto Zuckerberg como otros lÃ­deres de la tecnolÃ³gica devuelvan a Meta el dinero pagado a la FTC y reembolsen otros gastos legales, que estiman en unos 8.000 millones de dÃ³lares.
Se espera que en este juicio sin jurado testifique el propio Zuckerberg , ademÃ¡s de otros empresarios como Peter Thiel, exmiembro de la junta directiva de Meta y cofundador de Palantir, o Reed Hastings, cofundador de Netflix y que tambiÃ©n formÃ³ parte de la junta directiva de la tecnolÃ³gica.

author: Meleah Lyden
title: Towns County Sheriff's Office searching for missing, endangered woman
text:
TOWNS COUNTY, Ga. â€” The Towns County Sheriff's Office is actively searching for a missing 47-year-old woman who was last seen in early April.
According to the
sheriff's office, it received a report of a missing person on April 17 regarding Tanya Michelle Sorrells of Young Harris. She was last seen on Sunday, April 6, at a residence in the Gumlog Road area. The sheriff's office said Sorrells had withdrawn money from her personal banking account and told a relative she was going to Columbia, South Carolina.
A phone ping was conducted on her cell phone and showed it in the Columbia area, according to the sheriff's office. Sorrells has been officially classified as a missing, endangered person. A Mattie's Call has also been issued due to some mental health struggles.
The Georgia Bureau of Investigation is assisting in this active investigation. The Towns County Sheriff's Office is asking for help locating Sorrells.
Anyone with information regarding her whereabouts is encouraged to contact the Towns County Sheriff's Office at 706-896-4444.

author: Bangkok Post Public Company Limited
title: Elon Musk adds Microsoft to suit against OpenAI
text: The amended complaint, filed Thursday in federal court in Northern California, makes new antitrust claims against OpenAI and adds defendants, including the tech giant Microsoft and venture capitalist Reid Hoffman.Microsoft is a close partner of OpenAI, after investing more than US$13 billion in the startup. Hoffman is a Microsoft board member and previously served on the board of OpenAI.The new legal filing also adds two plaintiffs to the suit alongside Musk: his startup xAI, which competes with OpenAI, and Shivon Zilis, a former OpenAI board member. Zilis is now an executive at Muskâ€™s brain implant company Neuralink and the mother of three of his children.OpenAI and Hoffman did not immediately respond to requests for comment. Microsoft declined to comment.Musk sued OpenAI in March in a state court in San Francisco, before withdrawing the suit without explanation. Seven weeks later, he filed a new suit in federal court, arguing that OpenAI violated federal racketeering laws by conspiring to defraud him.Like the original suit, the federal complaint claimed that OpenAI and two of its founders, Sam Altman and Greg Brockman, breached the company's founding contract by putting commercial interests ahead of the public good.After joining with Musk to create OpenAI in 2015 and pledging to carefully develop artificial intelligence (AI) for the benefit of humanity, the suit claimed, Altman and Brockman abandoned this mission by entering its multibillion-dollar partnership with Microsoft.Musk stepped away from OpenAI in 2018, before that partnership was created.In the amended complaint, Musk argued that OpenAI is trying to eliminate competitors like xAI by insisting that its investors refrain from funding these rivals. He also argued that xAI had been harmed because OpenAI's partnership with Microsoft allowed the two companies to trade "competitively sensitive information."A keyboard is placed in front of a displayed OpenAI logo in this illustration taken February 21, 2023. (Photo: Reuters)Both Hoffman and Dee Templeton, a Microsoft vice president, had undermined antitrust laws because they were involved with the boards of Microsoft and OpenAI, according to the complaint."The purpose of the prohibition on interlocking directorates is to prevent sharing of competitively sensitive information," the complaint read.In adding Zilis as a plaintiff in the suit, the new filing said that she repeatedly raised concerns over OpenAIâ€™s dealings while serving as a board member. She left the OpenAI board last year.(The New York Times sued OpenAI and Microsoft in December for copyright infringement of news content related to AI systems.)This article originally appeared in The New York Times.

author: AOL Staff
title: Missouri closes strong to defeat shorthanded Ohio State in Cotton Bowl
text: Missouri closes strong to defeat shorthanded Ohio State in Cotton Bowl ARLINGTON, Texas â€” A reporter called them "The Big Three" in the lead up to the game. And boy, did the St. Louis trio prove that nickname right. When Missouri seemed down and out, it turned to running back Cody Schrader, quarterback Brady Cook and wide receiver Luther Burden III. They came to the rescue. No. 9 Mizzou, at the end of its spellbinding season, is the Cotton Bowl champion. The Tigers claimed the New Yearâ€™s Six Bowl win with a 14-3 victory over No. 7 Ohio State on Friday evening in AT&T Stadium. For a while, there were more punts than completed passes. Mizzou wonâ€™t care one bit, as it finished the year 11-2 and has its first bowl victory of the Eli Drinkwitz era. Here are three instant takeaways as the Tigers knocked off the Buckeyes: Cody Schrader's swan song Nothing was working. Indeed, nothing the Tigers tried looked remotely close to working. That is until speedy freshman wide receiver Marquis Johnson, playing in his home state, took off downfield late in the third quarter and hauled in Brady Cookâ€™s pass for a 49-yard gain to the Ohio State 15-yard line. Prior to that point, Missouri had managed just 40 passing yards. The Tigers had not yet visited the red zone. An illegal substitution took Missouri to the 10. A false start sent them right back. Brady Cook hustled for 8 yards, bringing an end to the third quarter. And then, the hero of so many Mizzou wins in this marvelous run to the New Year's Six, Schrader, did what he so often does. The running back tore right up the middle, took a couple hits from the Buckeyes who had beat MU's offense blue all evening, but stayed upright before falling across the goal line. Tigers 7, Buckeyes 3. Points, at last. Of course, it was Schrader, who was playing in his final game of college football and broke the Tigers' single-season rushing record. Gutsy fourth-down call seals it It was fourth-and-1 on the edge of the red zone with 6:38 remaining in the fourth quarter. Drinkwitz decided on a timeout. Harrison Mevis joined the huddle. Surely, a touchdown lead would suit Missouri. But with a minute remaining until the all-important do-or-die play, the kicker walked back to the sideline. Missouri was going for gold. Cook didnâ€™t disappoint. He faked a pitch left â€” the second time heâ€™d done that on fourth down on the day â€” turned his attention to the middle of the field and took off running. He made it. Schrader took a carry 11 yards left. He scampered three more on the next play. Then, the St. Louis QB-receiver duo connected. Cook found Burden from 7 yards â€” nearly doubling Burdenâ€™s receiving yards for the day â€” at the back edge of the end zone. Burden spiked the football. The Tigers had a two-score lead. The day was done. DCs dial up the heat The turnaround masked a lot of offensive inefficiencies. Whatever the Cotton Bowl budgeted for first-half, post-touchdown fireworks, they overspent. By the end of the first quarter, the teams had combined for 104 total yards of offense and 27 passing yards. The only points on the board were courtesy of a 44-yard field goal from Ohio State kicker Jayden Fielding. Missouri defensive coordinator Blake Baker was awarded a contract extension, the team announced about a week ago. He celebrated by bringing the heat. Joe Moore III recovered a fumble with three minutes remaining in the game after safety Daylan Carnell sacked backup QB Lincoln Kienholz. If it wasn't over before, it was then. Missouri defensive end Johnny Walker Jr. broke the Ohio State line on the second play of the second quarter and forced a fumble inside the OSU 10-yard line from Devin Brown, who was starting his first game at quarterback. Kienholz, a true freshman, entered the game early in the second quarter as Brown took the next snap, but eventually limped off to the locker room. Missouri finished the half with 112 yards of offense, 28 of which came through the air. Ohio State managed just 76 yards of total offense as Mizzou racked up eight â€” yes, eight â€” first-half tackles for loss. This article originally appeared on Columbia Daily Tribune: [Missouri wins Cotton Bowl by shutting down Ohio State](https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/ncaaf/2023/12/29/missouri-wins-cotton-bowl-ohio-state/72064683007/)
